author: Unknown
text:
Our Information Technology department is looking to improve IT services provided to other City departments.  The first step is to formally define services through a Service Level Agreement.  This SLA will ensure valued IT services are delivered to achieveable targets that have been agreed upon with the departments.  Defining, establishing and measuring through  metrics is then key for reporting on the success of the service delivery.  How the departments are able to manage their desired services, and costs, is also important to cover in the SLA.
Our IT department provides the standard computer services: Client Services (help desk, pc setup, software deployment), Application Services (application development, integrations to 3rd party software, gis support), and Technical Services (network configuration & admin, database support, server setup and admin).  
We are interested if your organization currently uses an SLA for the provision of IT services, and if so, would you be open to sharing this document with our IT Department.  Also of interest is how you capture and report on the metrics to support your SLA.
Your input on how you approached the SLA would certainly assist us in improving our services and partnerships with our customers.
Thank you in advance for any SLA information you can provide,
Dan Anderson, GM of ICS
City of Medicine Hat
title: Developing SLA for IT services
